item.title: Order at the table
item.description: This message challenges cultural assumptions and emphasizes God’s design for order and reverence, especially in worship and communion, calling believers to study Scripture thoughtfully and honor what God declares as sacred.
item.author: Jeremy Havlin

item.title: Lessons from the Past: Living for God’s Glory
item.description: A call to remember Israel’s failures and God’s faithfulness, urging believers to resist temptation, ask wise questions and live every moment for the glory of God; not just for permission, but with purpose.
item.author: Pat Cronin

item.title: A life that matters
item.description: Challenges us to move beyond self-centered living by intentionally choosing a life of purpose, sacrifice and devotion to God’s greater calling.
item.author: Jeremy Havlin

item.title: Love over liberty
item.description: Teaches that Christian freedom must be guided by love, encouraging believers to value others’ faith over personal liberties.
item.author: Joe Cuyar

item.title: Devotion in every season
item.description: Highlights God’s design for the body, marriage and singleness, calling for covenant faithfulness, purposeful living and undivided devotion to Christ.
item.author: Gabe Pecoraro

item.title: Building what lasts
item.description: Addresses spiritual immaturity and division, challenging the church to grow, build with purpose and trust God for lasting transformation.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: Power over persuasion
item.description: Contrasts human wisdom with the power of the Spirit, calling believers to rely on God’s strength and spiritual insight rather than impressive words or intellect.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: Sources of doubt
item.description: Affirms that doubt is part of the faith journey, not a failure, by exploring its roots and offering a path toward trust, honesty and deeper belief.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: Lies the world tells us
item.description: Exposes cultural lies about self-sufficiency, hopelessness and conformity, urging believers to live in freedom by depending on God’s grace and truth.
item.author: Pat Cronin

item.title: Easter
item.description: A celebration of Jesus’ inclusive invitation into relationship with God, unpacking the depth of His promise to dwell with and be known by us.
item.author: Charlie Boyd

item.title: Palm Sunday
item.description: Jesus enters as King on His terms, inviting heartfelt worship, confronting false expectations and revealing where our true devotion lies.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: Guard your heart
item.description: A direct challenge to examine who or what rules your life, contrasting worldly influences with the freedom found in surrendering to Jesus.
item.author: Joe Cuyar

item.title: Ownership and stewardship
item.description: A practical guide to wise financial living through biblical stewardship, calling believers to generosity, contentment and eternal investment.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: Stronger through suffering
item.description: A reflection on the clash between worldly and Kingdom values, revealing how surrender and suffering can lead to transformation and eternal reward.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: Open hands and holy patience
item.description: Challenges believers to trust God with their wealth, timing and healing, living with open hands, patience and persistent prayer.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: Fighting the wrong battles
item.description: Explores the root of conflict, the dangers of pride and the futility of self-centered plans, urging humility and dependence on God’s direction.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: Tested faith, trusted God
item.description: A message on trusting God through trials, emphasizing that tested faith is trustworthy, hope is rooted in Christ and obedience leads to peace.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: Count the cost
item.description: Challenges listeners to reflect on their personal surrender and commitment to Jesus, outlining the practices of discipleship and the intentional path to spiritual maturity.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: Being formed
item.description: An encouragement to trust Jesus even when the full plan isn’t clear, because He is good, able and worthy, by quieting distractions and taking faithful steps.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: Become like Jesus
item.description: Explores why transformation is hard, highlighting the importance of pairing truth with action, staying in community and committing to long-term spiritual growth.
item.author: Matt Humphrey

item.title: The cost
item.description: A call to follow Jesus not just for eternal life but to radically reshape everyday living, emphasizing surrender, obedience and the cost of discipleship.
item.author: Matt Humphrey
